roleset.name: to reach or achieve, achievment/acquisition
roleset.note: ATTAIN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'attain' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from attain.01-v predicate notes)
ATTAINMENT-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-6. (from attainment.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: [*-3] Having attained positions of real influence or wealth , [these men]*-3 constitute the Old Guard of New York City black politics ; they are less confrontational than the younger , more activist black political community that [*T*-2] has been based [*-1] largely in Brooklyn .
example.arg: positions of real influence or wealth

example.name: arg1, ADJ
example.text: This also presents a strong slap in the face for those officials who are obsessed with high educational attainments in the selection of personnel .

roleset.name: to reach or achieve
roleset.note: ATTAINABLE-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2& 3. Framed by Claire. Relation to verb-attain.01. (from attainable.01-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: A lot of the nuclear weapons tech that was unattainabe 20 - 30 years ago is attaintable now . It would be very expensive , and there would be consequences .
example.arg: A lot of the nuclear weapons tech that was unattainabe 20 - 30 years ago

example.name: All args
example.text: The highest peaks of the mountain were attainable to me and my agents, and the lowest valleys were made plain paths.
example.arg: The highest peaks of the mountain
